author: jgm
content: Some variant of bech32 seems like a decent enough option if made against a 32-byte value (which would be hash of pubkey with version and shard ID replacing some bytes). bech32 itself got a bit mixed up with the segwit stuff being part of the spec, if I remember correctly

author: jgm
content: From https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/issues/1183 a bech32 encoding of a 32-byte value would look something like `eth1m0ad9f4lkrnlru8523sfgnaa3ha87d76q6jdzwees0xfpw6xjcas7ucq5e`, which is large but not egregiously so
